data.title: Cant believe this is only my first time here!
data.text: Had a fun ladies weekend shopping and ended our trip with lunch at Nordstrom Café.  Cant believe I have never been here before!  I had the turkey bacon Panini and it was sooooo good.  It came with homemade chips and let me say it was delicious every bite!

data.title: The Best Salads
data.text: My girlfriend an I always go here for lunch downtown because they have the best salads. My favorite is the Nicoise Salad with salmon. You get a good size piece of salmon with it. Also, I love the Lime Cilantro Chicken Salad. And, they have wine if you want a glass with your meal.

data.title: Pretty good quick
data.text: We're doing some specialty shopping w hen we needed to stop for dinner. Ordered the skirt steak and veggies. Steak was perfect. Had a glass of wine. Also very good. Service was friendly. Overall, a bit pricy but quality was very good.

data.title: Take a Break from Shopping
data.text: You can't go wrong with the tomato basil soup and a glass of the house red.  Makes shopping oh-so-much more pleasant.

data.title: Nice Cafe Tucked in the Back of the 3rd Floor
data.text:
While doing a little shopping one evening, my husband and I decided to eat at this rather obscure cafe on the 3rd floor of the downtown Nordstrom.  It's a busy little place with a not too shabby menu for dinner.  You order at the counter and a server brings the food to your table.  The atmosphere is casually elegant, the service is fast and friendly, and the prices are comparable to similar mid-priced establishments.  I ordered the salmon and asparagus pasta dish and my husband had a lamb sandwich.  Both were very good, although for the price of my meal ($14), it didn't come with a salad or any other side dishes.  Same for the lamb sandwich.  Each of us ordered a glass of wine ($9 - $10 a glass).  Our server did try and upsell us on the wine and suggested that we could buy the bottle if we really liked our glasses of wine.     
We also ordered a chocolate and coconut bar for dessert.  Really good and the other dessert options looked appealing as well.  

If you're looking for something away from the crowds and still want to be in the downtown mall area, this is a nice option.

data.title: Great lunch spot ....
data.text: I love to have lunch at the Nordstrom Café in downtown Spokane.  The food is always good, the service is wonderful, and it is so convenient.  I usually have a half turkey/cranberry sandwich on ciabatta bread (I don't care for the whole grain bread) and a small salad.  The thing is .... they don't advertise half sandwiches or the fact that you can have a different kind of bread.  You can pretty much order what you want, which I truly appreciate.  The tomato basil soup is really good, the salad greens are always very fresh, and the cookies are so good.  While you order at the counter as you enter the café, the servers are very quick to bring your beverages and meals.  The service staff is great, friendly, attentive, and always smiling.  The Nordstrom Café is just a great place for lunch if you are downtown.

data.title: Nice place for lunch
data.text: My friend and I eat lunch here often when downtown as the food is tasty and the service is fast and very helpful and pleasant.  It is a pleasant atmosphere.  We enjoy just going to visit our wait person who always remembers us and what we order.

data.title: Hidden treasure with super salads and more!
data.text:
Recently I met up with a favorite Spokane friend of mine for lunch.  When she suggested we meet at the Nordstrom Cafe, my first response was... "I always forget that place is there."  Well, I shouldn't.  This little cafe is worth a stop for lunch or dinner on any day!

Tucked away on the third floor of Spokane's downtown Nordstrom, this sweet little eatery offers delicious soups, salads and a variety of sandwiches along with some mighty tempting desserts.

I settled on the grilled shrimp and arugula salad.   It came with perfectly toasted cubes of polenta, crumbled parmesan crackers, nice big grilled prawns and tons of fresh greens, all tossed with a light creamy garlic vinaigrette.  It was simply delicious!  

My girlfriend had the cilantro chicken salad and between the two of us making yummy noises while we worked our way through lunch, we still managed to have a fun and intimate conversation, because the place is quiet and features booths as well as tables.

Since we'd been so pious to have salads for lunch, we splurged and split a maple pecan cookie and coffee for dessert.  Again, well worth the calories and plenty big for two people who just want a nibble of something sweet.

The Nordstrom Cafe is unexpectedly delightful and well worth stopping for a meal again soon!

data.title: Notevole ristorante all'interno di Nordstrom
data.text: Inserito all'ultimo piano dei grandi magazzini Nordstrom  il Cafè è una piacevole sorpresa per la qualità e varietà dei piatti e per la gentilezza e premurosità del personale, da non mancare un assaggio della tomato soup, veramente gustosa.
